title: ISic020600. ISic020600
body:
1ͱε̄ρακλεῖ

1ͰΕ̄ΡΑΚΛΕΙ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Arena 1998 (IGASM 5)

English translation

Valentina Mignosa

To Heracles.

Italian translation

Valentina Mignosa

A Eracle.

commentary

The dedication is written in an alphabet aberrant to the context of Syracuse, in which it was found. According to Jeffery (1961), the alphabet is of the Megarian type, which she explains by suggesting that those (the pacheis) transported by Gelon to Syracuse from Megara Hyblaea had made a dedication using, for reasons she does not further investigate, the alphabet of the mother country. According to Guarducci (1959-1960), on the other hand, the alphabet would undoubtedly be Corinthian and could easily be explained by the presence of Corinthians or Corcyraeans in Syracuse around the fifth century.

bibliography

  • Jeffery J.WC.MegH.30.p.01 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002294
  • Guarducci 1959-1960 250, fig. 2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001928
  • Jeffery 1961 276 no.30 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000677
  • Arena 1989 75, fig. 13 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000638
  • Dubois 1989 90 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000187
  • Jeffery Johnston 1990 276 no.30 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000678
  • Arena 1998 95 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000637
